greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = smallest positive integer not already in sequence such that the partial sum a(1)+...+a(n) is prime.
comment: 1 is the only odd number in this sequence. - _Derek Orr_, Feb 07 2015
Conjecture: Every even numbers appears. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 29 2017
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (terms n = 1..4100 from N. J. A. Sloane).
mathematica: t = {2}; Do[i = 1; While[! PrimeQ[Total[t] + i] || MemberQ[t, i], i++]; AppendTo[t, i], {65}]; t (* _Jayanta Basu_, Jul 04 2013 *)
xref: In A055265 only pairs of adjacent terms add to primes.
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, May 09 2000
